page.title: 05DUKINFIELD WAR MEMORIAL
page.content: The Dukinfield War Memorial is situated directly opposite the old Chapel Church at the top of Chapel Hill. The memorial was inaugurated in sacred memory of Dukinfield men who served and died for their country in the Great War and was unveiled on 30 July 1922. The structure comprises of a foundation of three tiers of stone steps and surmounted with a cast bronze figure of a soldier 7ft 6ins high in full fighting kit. Each side of the column is ornamented with laurel wreaths and on the front is carved the Dukinfield coat-of-arms in relief. On the front and back of the frieze are cut the letters "To our noble dead" and "Men of Dukinfield". Fixed on the four sides of the column are cast bronze panels 4ft by 2ft 6ins with 460 names of the dead. After the Second World War more
